intro: Sagraea cornuta, commonly known as the horned sagraea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Sagraea cornuta is often found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a notable species in Mediterranean botany.
